Song.title: My Jesus I Love Thee
Song.copyright: Words & Music by William R. Featherstone; Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: My J[D]es[G]us, I [F#m7]love [Bm]Thee,{,} I [Em7]know [A]Thou art [D]mine For [D]Thee [G]all the f[F#m7]oll[Bm]ies of [Em7]sin [A]I res[D]ign My gr[D]aci[G]ous [D/F#m]Red[Em]eem[A]er, my S[D]avi[G]or [A/F#]art Th[Em7]ou [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#-F#7]loved [Bm]Thee, my J[Em7]es[A]us, 'tis n[D]ow
Verse 2: I [D]love [G]Thee bec[F#m7]ause [Bm]Thou{,} hast [Em7]first [A]loved [D]me And [D]purch[G]ased my [F#m7]pard[Bm]on on [Em7]Calv[A]ary's [D]tree I [D]love [G]Thee [D/F#]for w[Em]ear[A]ing{,} the th[D]orns [G]on [A/F#]Thy [Em7]brow [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#-F#7]loved [Bm]Thee, my [Em7]Jes[A]us, 'tis [D]now
Verse 3: I [D]love [G]Thee in [F#m7]life, [Bm]I will [Em7]love [A]Thee in d[D]eath And [D]praise [G]Thee as [F#m7]long [Bm]as Thou [Em7]lend[A]est me b[D]reath I'll [D]sing [G]when [D/F#]the [Em]death [A]dew lies [D]cold [G]on [A/F#]my [Em7]brow [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#-F#7]loved [Bm]Thee my [Em7]Jes[A]us 'tis [D]now
Verse 4: In [D]mans[G]ions of [F#m7]glor[Bm]y and [Em7]endl[A]ess del[D]ight I'll [D]ev[G]er ad[F#m7]ore [Bm]Thee in [Em7]heav[A]en so [D]bright I'll [D]sing [G]with [D/F#m]the [Em]glitter[A]ing cr[D]own{,} [G]on [A/F#]my [Em7]brow [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#-F#7]loved [Bm]Thee, my [Em7]Jes[A]us, 'tis [D]now
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 my jesus i love thee i know thou art mine for thee all the follies of sin i resign my gracious redeemer my savior art thou if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 2 i love thee because thou hast first loved me and purchased my pardon on calvarys tree i love thee for wearing the thorns on thy brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 3 i love thee in life i will love thee in death and praise thee as long as thou lendest me breath ill sing when the death dew lies cold on my brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 4 in mansions of glory and endless delight ill ever adore thee in heaven so bright ill sing with the glittering crown on my brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: My J[D]es[G]us, I [D]love [Bm]Thee,{,} I [Em7]know [A]Thou art [D]mine For [D]Thee [G]all the f[D]oll[Bm]ies of [Em7]sin [A]I res[D]ign My gr[D]aci[G]ous Red[Em]eem[A]er, my S[D]avi[G]or art Th[D/F#]ou [A] If [D]ev[G]er I [D]loved [Bm]Thee, my J[Em7]es[A]us, 'tis n[D]ow
Verse 2: I [D]love [G]Thee bec[D]ause [Bm]Thou{,} hast [Em7]first [A]loved [D]me And [D]purch[G]ased my [D]pard[Bm]on on [Em7]Calv[A]ary's [D]tree I [D]love [G]Thee for w[Em]ear[A]ing{,} the th[D]orns [G]on Thy [D/F#]brow [A] If [D]ev[G]er I [D]loved [Bm]Thee, my [Em7]Jes[A]us, 'tis [D]now
Verse 3: In [E]mans[A]ions of [E]glor[C#m]y and [F#m7]endl[B]ess del[E]ight I'll [E]ev[A]er ad[E]ore [C#m]Thee in [F#m7]heav[B]en so [E]bright I'll [E]sing [A]with the [F#m]glitter[B]ing cr[E]own{,} [A]on my [E/G#]brow [B] If [E]ev[A]er I [E]loved [C#m]Thee, my [F#m7]Jes[B]us, 'tis [E]now
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 my jesus i love thee i know thou art mine for thee all the follies of sin i resign my gracious redeemer my savior art thou if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 2 i love thee because thou hast first loved me and purchased my pardon on calvarys tree i love thee for wearing the thorns on thy brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 3 in mansions of glory and endless delight ill ever adore thee in heaven so bright ill sing with the glittering crown on my brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: My J[D]es[G]us, I [F#m7]love [Bm]Thee,{,} I [Em7]know [A]Thou art [D]mine For [D]Thee [G]all the f[F#m7]oll[Bm]ies of [Em7]sin [A]I res[D]ign My gr[D]aci[G]ous [D/F#m]Red[Em]eem[A]er, my S[D]avi[G]or [D/F#]art Th[Em7]ou [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#m7]loved [Bm]Thee, my J[Em7]es[A]us, 'tis n[D]ow
Verse 2: I [D]love [G]Thee bec[F#m7]ause [Bm]Thou{,} hast [Em7]first [A]loved [D]me And [D]purch[G]ased my [F#m7]pard[Bm]on on [Em7]Calv[A]ary's [D]tree I [D]love [G]Thee [D/F#]for w[Em]ear[A]ing{,} the th[D]orns [G]on [D/F#]Thy [Em7]brow [A7] If [D]ev[G]er I [F#m7]loved [Bm]Thee, my [Em7]Jes[A]us, 'tis [D]now
CHORUS 2: Jesus, You [Gmaj7]are bea[G6]utif[D2/F#]ul Jesus, You [Gmaj7]are bea[G]utif[F#m7]ul Because You f[G]irst loved me, I l[D2/F#]ove You Because You f[G/B]irst loved me, I l[D2/F#]ove You Because You f[G]irst loved me, I l[D2/F#]ove You [Gmaj7]Jesus, [A]You are beautif[Bm]ul [Gmaj7]Jesus, [A]You are beautif[D]ul
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 my jesus i love thee i know thou art mine for thee all the follies of sin i resign my gracious redeemer my savior art thou if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now verse 2 i love thee because thou hast first loved me and purchased my pardon on calvarys tree i love thee for wearing the thorns on thy brow if ever i loved thee my jesus tis now chorus 2 jesus you are beautiful jesus you are beautiful because you first loved me i love you because you first loved me i love you because you first loved me i love you jesus you are beautiful jesus you are beautiful
